poem:
Camp Mystic Amid the Storm

In the quiet before dawn,  
the river whispered secrets,  
swollen under a pale sky.  
Voices echoed through pines,  
laughter captured in leaves,  
but the waters rose,  
breathing a heavy silence.  
Now the campfire's ashes  
float among the stars,  
and prayers drift gently,  
like fireflies in the night.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. We are praying for them constantly,” a statement on the camp website read. The search". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
